problem_text:
Let M < G ⩽ Sym(Ω), where Ω is finite, be such that M is transitive on Ω and there is a G-invariant partition P of Ω × Ω \ {(α, α) | α ∈ Ω} such that G is transitive on the set of parts of P and M fixes each part of P setwise. (Here P can be identified with a decomposition of the complete directed graph with vertex set Ω into edge-disjoint isomorphic directed graphs.) If G induces a cyclic permutation group on P, then we showed (Trans. Amer. Math. Soc., 355, no. 2 (2003), 637–653) that the numbers n = |Ω| and k = |P| are such that the r-part n_r of n satisfies n_r ≡ 1 (mod k) for each prime r. Are there examples with G inducing a non-cyclic permutation group on P for any n, k not satisfying this congruence condition?
C. H. Li, C. E. Praeger
